p: The median (IQR) time from the onset of the symptoms to medical consultation was 4 (3–7) days. Cough ( n = 45, 87%) and fever ( n = 42, 82%) were the most common symptoms, while gastrointestinal symptoms including nausea or vomiting ( n = 4, 8%) or diarrhea ( n = 16, 31%) were rare. Of 38 (72%) patients with a chest radiograph at admission, 26 (70%) had bilateral involvement ( n = 18, 69%) or interstitial pattern in ( n = 12, 43%) as the most common radiological features.
